com.communote.server.api

Class ServiceLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.api.ServiceLocator

  • public class ServiceLocator
extends Object
    Locator for Spring services of the core ApplicationContext. This is especially useful for situations where autowiring is not possible.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Detail

      • findService

        public static final <T> T findService(Class<T> serviceClass)
        Get the service with the given type. Using this method is equivalent to instance(). getService(Class). If the service does not exist or the application context was not initialized a runtime exception will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the service
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - Class of the service
        Returns:
        The service.

      • instance

        public static final ServiceLocator instance()
        Get the singleton instance.
        Returns:
        the service locator or null if the application context was not yet initialized

      • isApplicationContextAvailable

        public static boolean isApplicationContextAvailable()
        Returns:
        whether the application context is available and instance() will return not null

      • getService

        public <T> T getService(Class<T> serviceClass)
        Get the service of the given type. The simple name of the class, with the first letter converted to lower case, will be used as name of the service. If there is no matching service a runtime exception will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the service
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - Class of the service
        Returns:
        the service

      • getService

        @Deprecated
public Object getService(String serviceName)
        Deprecated. Use getService(Class) or getService(String, Class) instead.
        Get a service by name. If there is no matching service a runtime exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - The name of the service
        Returns:
        the service

      • getService

        public <T> T getService(String serviceName,
                        Class<T> serviceClass)
        Get a service by name that has the given type. If there is no such service a runtime exception will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the service
        Parameters:
        serviceName - The name of the service
        serviceClass - Class of the service
        Returns:
        the service

      • getVirusScanner

        public VirusScanner getVirusScanner()
                             throws InitializeException
        Returns:
        the virus scanner or null if virus scanning is disabled
        Throws:
        InitializeException - if virus scanning is enabled but the selected scanner was not correctly initialized
